The bed in the navy room was so comfortable we almost slept through check out time! There are ample supplies, towels, plates, blankets, pillows, etc. The backyard has a fireplace and there are logs on site.
There is a basket of goodies/snacks/ramen in the kitchen. Ridiculous amounts of counter space, huge fridge and freezer. There is a lot of coffee pods and condiments in the fridge.
Really a lovely stay, sorry for the novel but there was a lot to gush about!

review_text: This was our second stay at Hilltop Hideaway. We were greeted yet again with a nice clean space, a personalized welcome sign and a little sweet treat (yummy cupcakes this time!). The inside of the tiny home was as sparkling clean inside as the last time. It was a little warmer this stay than the last time so we spent even more time utilizing all the outdoor spaces. The large covered deck with a propane heater is fabulous. Especially if you have a rain out morning like we did (rain in the morning meant a private "mountain" to ski on in the afternoon!). We sat out on the deck and stayed warm and dry and enjoyed watching the few skiers out in the pouring rain from our dry and warm seats on the deck. We also enjoyed the fire ring with plenty of wood provided by the host. There is really not much tiny about this tiny home the great room has huge windows and high ceilings, a nice large kitchen, bathroom space and plenty of places to put things in cupboards and out of the way. The loft space is very spacious with a nice comfy mattress (with PLENTY of room to spare) up there for adults or kids. The bedroom has a sliding glass door out onto the covered deck, a TV, a fireplace and plenty of storage space for your belongings. Our favorite part of the bedroom is being able to lay in bed and watch Mad River Mountain make snow at night or skiers in the morning. You are close enough to the slopes to watch, but just back far enough from the runs that go behind the house to not feel like when you have the curtain open everyone is looking in at you. This property would be enjoyable year round with all of its space inside and out. Enjoy your stay! I know we did and we will be back!

Loved, loved, loved this place! It was immaculately clean, quiet, and cozy. It’s small, but big enough for a couple or a family with small kids. We could look out the bedroom patio doors to a beautiful view of the top of the ski slopes. The bed was very comfortable; we slept so good all 3 nights. Full-size appliances and enough cookware for general cooking needs. The gas fireplace was enough to keep the place warm and helped provide a cozy feel, so we didn’t need to turn on the heat (visited mid-October). Bathroom had lots of storage and counter space. The large counter in the kitchen had 4 very comfortable stools around it, and the farmhouse sink was huge! Upstairs, the loft was much bigger than expected. It would be perfect for small kids up there - they would have lots of room up there to play and feel like they had their own spot. It rained most of one day, so we pulled out the sofa bed in the living area to lounge back, watch tv, and read. Cell phone coverage was fast (AT&T) and reliable. No WiFi or cable, but lots of stations from the digital antennae.
Overall, the campground was quiet and peaceful, and we enjoyed walking around the campground and to the top of the slopes. The view from up there was amazing! It was about a 15-minute drive to nearby Bellefontaine, which has lots of cute shops and great restaurants. There were also various hiking trails within a 30-minute drive, as well as a riding stable right across 33.
The funny thing is that I have driven by Mad River Mountain hundreds of times back and forth to Columbus and back. Can’t believe this is the first time I actually travelled up that mountain! :-) We live only an hour away and we will be coming back often when we need to relax and unwind! We so enjoyed our stay and appreciated the cupcakes and snacks - what a nice touch!

The listing and pictures from the exterior are very deceiving. None of the pictures are from the "private" patio, which has minimal viewing pleasure. The pictures on the listing are from the owners front porch and their elevated deck. The listing also states that it is a quiet serene vacation destination. While I did understand that we would be staying in the basement of the owners house who live there, I didn't expect to have to deal with the level of noise that we experienced. Apparently they were entertaining guests all day Saturday and there appeared to be no attempt to keep the noise of running, jumping or talking to a reasonable level. We had to keep turning up the volume on the TV to hear over it, that's when I messaged the owners who then moved the entertaining outside. The set up of the deck steps coming right onto the private patio made a private patio, not so private. This feeling of not having privacy would have been lessened if there were curtains on the windows. The listing also states that the hot tub is private. It was clearly used while we were away for a few hours on Saturday. There was no chance we were going to be able to use it on Saturday night due to the owners moving their entertainment to the fire pit that sits about 15 feet away from the hot tub. The listing also shows that the entry is with a lockbox. There was a lockbox there, though it wasn't used and when we left the property at any time it was left unlocked. No mattress on the lower bunk of the bunkbed, so one of the adults had to sleep on the loft bed that wasn't ideal for our situation.
Open communication goes a long way. We weren't given a heads up that they would be entertaining and that it may be louder than usual.
The positives are that the space was clean, updated, spacious and comfortable plush carpet.
